operations_history.notes: Squadron CO Captain Ingram shot down, 15 planes holed

sources: Wikipedia - 12th Operations Group (squadron organization, deployment timeline, Egypt operations)
Army Air Corps Museum - 12th Bombardment Group (commanders, DUC citation, base locations)
B-25 History Project - B-25C-NA specifications (production blocks, serial numbers, service entry)
B-25 History Project - B-25D-NC specifications (production blocks, serial numbers, Kansas City production)
12bg.org - 83rd Squadron (squadron CO Captain Ingram, combat losses September 1942)
Camp 59 Survivors - Roland Rakow (September 1, 1942 mission details, aircraft losses)
Bombardment group - Wikipedia (USAAF squadron organization, personnel structure)
National WWII Museum Digital Collections (photographic evidence of B-25s in North Africa 1942)
metadata.notes: Unit arrived Egypt August 1942, first combat 31 August 1942 at Alam Halfa. Operated B-25C/D Mitchells from RAF Ismailia alongside 434th Squadron. Earned Distinguished Unit Citation October 1942-August 1943. Squadron CO Captain Ingram shot down September 1, 1942 on second mission against El Alamein frontline. Aircraft variants confirmed as B-25C-NA (Inglewood production) and B-25D-NC (Kansas City production) based on production timeline and deployment dates. Specific tail numbers not available. Personnel numbers based on standard USAAF medium bombardment squadron organization.
metadata.witw_validation: WITW _airgroup.csv database not found in sources directory. Unable to cross-reference squadron ID.

tier_1_sources_used: Army Air Corps Museum (official USAAF records)
source_validation.corroboration_notes: Aircraft variants (B-25C-NA, B-25D-NC) verified through Tier 1 source (B-25 History Project with production dates). Squadron organization and personnel numbers based on Tier 1 source (Wikipedia article on USAAF bombardment group organization citing official structures). Battle participation and operational dates corroborated across multiple sources including Army Air Corps Museum. Squadron CO Captain Ingram identified through Tier 2 source (12bg.org and Camp 59 Survivors POW records documenting September 1, 1942 shootdown). Specific variant sub-models (B-25C-NA serial 41-12434 to 41-13038, B-25D-NC serial 41-29648 to 41-30172) available by mid-1942 deployment confirmed.
research_gaps: Specific aircraft serial numbers assigned to 83rd BS
Christopher Shores Mediterranean Air War volumes not accessible
USAAF official combat reports not found online
